Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw at least two different habitats, such as a land habitat (e.g., playground, garden, forest, or parking lot) and a water habitat (e.g., pond, stream, or lake).

The student can include a variety of plants and animals in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants for land habitats, and fish, clams for water habitats.
The student can identify and clearly label each different living thing in their drawings.
The student can show how the living things are different between the two habitats, highlighting the diversity in each location.
The student can make observations in their drawings that demonstrate patterns in where different types of plants and animals live.
The student can organize the information in their drawing to clearly show comparisons between the two habitats.
